intro: Glochidion drypetifolium, commonly known as the hairy leaf glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine, stinging hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers typically occurring on separate plants. Glochidion drypetifolium is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
